name: Lalibela
clues: I am home to eleven medieval monolithic cave churches carved out of rock.
My churches were built to be a 'New Jerusalem' after Muslim conquests halted pilgrimages.
The Church of St. George is my most famous structure, carved in the shape of a cross.
I am named after the Zagwe dynasty king who commissioned my construction.

name: Addis Ababa
clues: My name means 'New Flower' in Amharic.
I am the headquarters of the African Union and often called the 'political capital of Africa'.
I sit at the foot of Mount Entoto and enjoy a mild climate despite being near the equator.
I am home to 'Lucy', one of the oldest hominid skeletons ever found.

name: Axum
clues: I was the capital of an ancient empire that was a contemporary of Rome and Persia.
Legend says the Ark of the Covenant rests in my Church of Our Lady Mary of Zion.
My landscape is dotted with giant obelisks or stelae, marking royal tombs.
I am considered the holiest city in Ethiopia for Orthodox Christians.

name: Gondar
clues: I am known as the 'Camelot of Africa' due to my medieval castles.
I was the imperial capital of Ethiopia for over 200 years.
Fasil Ghebbi is my royal enclosure, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
My Debre Berhan Selassie church is famous for its ceiling of winged angel heads.

name: Harar
clues: I am a walled city with 82 mosques and over 100 shrines.
I am famous for a nightly tradition where men feed wild hyenas by hand.
I am considered the fourth holiest city in Islam.
My old town is known as Jugol and is a maze of narrow alleyways.
